snippet: Duke Energy said Friday that it was diverting the flow of coal ash away from the Dan River, but the company could not yet declare the huge spill fully contained nearly a week after it was discovered.
abstract: Duke Energy says it is diverting the flow of coal ash away from the Dan River in North Carolina but company cannot yet declare the huge spill fully contained; engineers have designed containment system that is capturing nearly all of the toxic runoff and pumping it back into a storage basin.
lead_paragraph: Duke Energy said Friday that it was diverting the flow of coal ash away from the Dan River, but the company could not yet declare the huge spill fully contained nearly a week after it was discovered.

headline.main: North Carolina: Coal Ash Leak Is Diverted but Not Contained
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Coal Ash Leak Is Diverted but Not Contained
